intro: Lasiospermum ensifolium, commonly known as the swordleaf mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can have a significant impact on the health of its host trees.
